com.xebialabs.overthere
Interface OverthereProcess

public interface OverthereProcess

Represents an executing process.

Method Summary
 void destroy()
          Destroys the executing process.
 java.io.InputStream getStderr()
          Returns an input stream that is connected to the standard error stream (stderr) of the running command.
 java.io.OutputStream getStdin()
          Returns an output stream that is connected to the standard input stream (stdin) of the running command.
 java.io.InputStream getStdout()
          Returns an input stream that is connected to the standard output stream (stdout) of the running command.
 int waitFor()
          Waits for the command to complete its execution.
 

Method Detail

java.io.OutputStream getStdin()
Returns an output stream that is connected to the standard input stream (stdin) of the running command.

Returns:
the input stream

java.io.InputStream getStdout()
Returns an input stream that is connected to the standard output stream (stdout) of the running command.

Returns:
the output stream

getStderr

java.io.InputStream getStderr()
Returns an input stream that is connected to the standard error stream (stderr) of the running command.

Returns:
the output stream

waitFor

int waitFor()
            throws java.lang.InterruptedException
Waits for the command to complete its execution. Note that destroy() still needs to be invoked to clean up any resources that may be left!

Returns:
the exit value of the executed command
Throws:
java.lang.InterruptedException - if this method was interrupted

destroy

void destroy()
Destroys the executing process.
